isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVES - CYLINDER HEAD (Reconditioning) - REASSEMBLY

step1.para: Clean valve faces and seats with a suitable cleaning solvent to remove dirt or foreign material. Blow dry all new and used components using filtered compressed air.
Lubricate the valve stems with clean engine oil.
Install intake and exhaust valves as follows:

step2.para: Insert valves in head in their respective seats.
INTAKE ONLY: Install new valve stem seals onto valve. stem using installer tool ZTSE4138 as follows:

Hold valve on its seat with one hand and install the clear plastic valve seal guide (part of ZTSE4138 as shown in Figure 3.61
.

Install the seal by hand until it rests on the end of the valve guide ( Figure 3.62
).

Use the seal installer ZTSE4138 to align the seal over the end of the valve guide as shown in Figure 3.63
. Apply only steady hand pressure until the seal bottoms squarely on the valve guide.
Remove the clear plastic valve seat guide.

figure.caption: Figure 3.62 Valve Stem Seal Installed by Hand Over Valve Seal Guide
Figure 3.63 Installing Valve Stem Seal onto Valve Stem Using Installer Tool ZTSE-4138

step1.para:
Install spring assembly as shown ( 4, Figure 3.59
).
Install a new exhaust valve oil shield into each valve spring retainer. Be sure each oil shield snaps into the retainer. Refer to Figure 3.64.
Install the exhaust valve spring retainer assembly (with oil shield) in the spring assembly and the intake valve spring retainer [without oil shield] into its respective spring assembly.

important.para: LATER PRODUCTION ENGINES ARE NOT BUILT WITH THE INTAKE (SMALL) OIL SHIELD. SERVICE OF EARLY PRODUCTION ENGINES NO LONGER REQUIRE INSTALLATION OF THE INTAKE OIL SHIELD. THE INTAKE OIL SHIELD MAY BE DELETED.
DO NOT TRY TO INSTALL THE LARGE EXHAUST OIL SHIELD ON THE INTAKE VALVE BECAUSE EXCESSIVE LUBE OIL CONSUMPTION CAN OCCUR, DUE TO INTERFERENCE OF THE OIL SHIELD WITH THE RUBBER STEM SEAL.

figure.caption: Figure 3.64 Installing Exhaust Oil Shield into Retainer

step1.para:
Compress the valve springs using valve spring compressor ZTSE1846. Install valve spring retainer locks ( 7, Figure 3.65
). Be sure locks are correctly seated on all valves.

After valve inspection, reconditioning/replacement and installation, measure valve head recession relative to deck ( Figure 3.66
) to confirm a good reconditioning job. Refer to SPECIFICATIONS

step2.para: Assure mating surface in head is free of debris.
Apply clean grease to the mounting edge of the pre-combustion chamber(s) and install in heads.
Tap lightly with a plastic hammer, if necessary.

note.para: When Installed, the pre-combustion chambers are acceptable with a 0.0025 in. protrusion above the cylinder head deck or a 0.0025 in. recession below the cylinder head deck.

step1.para: Install fuel injection nozzles. (See Torque Data, Appendix.)
Install glow plugs using deep socket. (See Torque Data, Appendix.)
